331 - 19 Dec 2023 09:04AM - +263 78 510 0890: GOD OF JUSTICE   A hard working and determined student, that's what Mufaro Marufu was. She completed her secondary education at Harare high school and tertiary education at University of Zimbabwe. She had studied Accounting and was lucky to get a job as soon as she finished her degree because jobs were very hard to find in Zimbabwe. Mufaro came from a middle class family of 6 children. Being the first child she was very hard working as she wanted to uplift her family. She started working in a town called Mutare as an accountant at House of Zeki, a company that used to pay her well. She could manage to pay school fees for for her 3 siblings and buy groceries for for her parents while they took care of other responsibilities. Mr and Mrs Marufu were very happy because their daughter had reduced their burden. While working at HOZ Mufaro fell in love with the CEO of the company. At first she refused to fall in love but ended up agreeing because the CEO was very charming, she fell for his sweet talks and besides he was very handsome that any girl would fall for him. The CEO's name was Michael Rwizi. Mufaro and Mr Rwizi started dating love was really on fire. They were the best couple that people admired. They used to wear matching clothes when going out for a date. After 2 years of dating Mufaro got pregnant. She informed Mr Rwizi but he denied it. "You are too loose Mufaro. How could you agree to sleep with a man without knowing anything about his background?What type of a woman are you? I am a married man. My family lives in Harare and I have 2 children. I can never accept that thing you are carrying as my child. Get lost and never show me your face again.Do you here me?" He said in a very fearce way."How can you call our child a thing Michael? You are the father of my....... "She did not finish talking and Michael interrupted her." Enough of your nonsense. I told you l am a married man, just get lost okay. In fact you are fired don't come to work again. "Immediately he wrote a fake report that Miss Marufu had stolen money from his cabin and got her out of the company without any hearing. Mufaro was very heartbroken, she was shattered in to pieces. Her soul was crushed especially when her character was questioned. She collected all her belongings and left HOZ in pain, tears and regret. "Why did l do it? How will l live now? How am I going to raise this child on my own? What will l say to people? And my parents, what am I going to explain to them? Ooogh dear Lord, what have I done? What have I got myself into?" She asked herself many questions as she was on her way back to Harare where here parents lived in a location called Budiriro. When she arrived her parents thought she was on leave. Everyone was happy to see her and they had supper together as a family. After supper everyone went to bed. Mrs Marufu followed Mufaro to her room. She sat on a chair which was beside the bed. "My daughter, what's eating you up? I have been noticing you ever since you arrived, you don't look happy what's wrong?" Mrs Marufu who used to know her daughter as a happy soul could notice that something was wrong. "Nothing mom, l am fine. It's just that I'm tired. You know I'm always busy at work. I'm very exhausted mom let me freshen up." She took her towel so that she could go and take a barth but before she even start walking her mother held her hand. "l know you Mufaro. I'm your mother I can see when you are happy and when you are not. Don't lie to me, share with me whatever it is." She said in a very calm tone, trying to figure out what was bothering her daughter. "Mother l am a shame, I have dissapointed you, l am so...... "She could not finish talking as she was already crying holding her mother." No my child, you are not like that, why are you even saying such things? "She was hugging Mufaro tightly calming her down. Mufaro finally gathered courage and told her mother everything. " Ooogh my God! What have you done my daughter? What will I tell your father? Did you forget how much he struggled for you to complete your studies at university of Zimbabwe?Did you forget he had to sell tomatoes in Mbare for you? He tolerated all the sun burns for who? It was for you Mufaro, is this how you repay him? Heee! Answer me! Are you dumb? "She was now fuming with anger. Mufaro had shattered her dreams." Jesus Christ of Nazareth, what have l done to deserve this?"Mrs Marufu yelled loudly that her husband woke up. He went to Mufaro's room. "What's happening Mufaro's mother? Why are you crying?" he asked curiously. "She is pr-e-g-na-nt, she is......"she didn't finish when Mr Marufu interrupted her." What! Is this what you have been teaching your daughter while I was out there trying to make her life better? Heeegh! Answer me Mufaro's mother, look at the out come of your upbringing. Now l understand why long ago boys and girls were never treated as equals. Because girls are worthless, they don't deserve education, they are useless, to heck with modernity and the so called gender equlity. I hate you Mufaro l hate you. Leave my house now. I said now! "Mufaro was now her mother's daughter because she had disgraced the family, but when she made the family proud she was Mr Marufu's pride and daughter. Mufaro left the house that night and went away. She was lucky enough to find a new job and started working again in Victoria Falls. She gave birth to a beautiful daughter and named her Anopaishe meaning God's gift. She raised Anopaishe alone as a single mother. Though she lived in a morden society, she faced a lot of troubles because of people who used to gossip about her. Some even called her daughter illegitimate, some used to call her characterlesss because she had a daughter out of wedlock. Society despite being morden still have some beliefs which noone can erase. However Mufaro managed to survive under such circumstances. She challenged societal beliefs that a child can not be raised without a father. She made herself a father and a mother to Anopaishe. She gave her the best education. She taught and natured her very well as she did not want Anopa to make the same mistake as hers. Anopaishe became a doctor after studying medicine in America for 7 years. After 7 years of education, Anopaishe came back home to Zimbabwe. She had found herself a boy who wanted to marry her whose name was Tinotenda Masuka. He came from a decent affluent family. His parents was happy with the allience and so was Mufaro Marufu. The two families fixed a date for the marriage. On the day of the marriage Mr Michael Rwizi showed up. It was now after 30 years. Mufaro almost fainted upon seeing him. "What are you doing here? You told me not to show my face to you again, so why are you here? Get lost l don't want my daughter's marriage to be ruined because of you." she shouted. "How can you get my daughter married without her father?Who is going to negotiate the bride price if I'm not here?" he said confidently with no shame. "What! Which daughter are you talking about Mr Rwizi? Are you talking about the daughter you rejected 3 decades ago? Do you have any idea of how she grew up, how she suffered because of you? When other kids were playing with their fathers where were you? She was labeled illegitimate, she always asked me about her father but I could not tell her that you rejected us because you have a family. I gave her my last name and today you claim that she is yours, really? Where do you even get the guts? Don't you have any shame? Why are you so greedy? You are here for the bride price right? You want lobola of a child you rejected, how dare you? You want cattle because you found out that her fiance is rich right? It's not happening Michael Rwizi. No! Not under my watch. I failed to fight for myself but today l will fight for my daughter and protect her from a shameless man like you. Get out of my house now. "she said looking into Michael 's eyes. He was very shocked to see that side of Mufaro." I am not greedy, but according to our Zimbabwean culture, it is the father who negotiate the bride price and the amount of cattle he wants to give his daughter for marriage, he takes the large amount of money. You know that this is my right and no one else. It's my right as a father not yours. Don't try to take away my rights. I will go nowhere because Anopaishe is my daughter and I am going to negotiate her lobola price. "he said with confidence and arrogance." Excuse me, l am sorry l don't know you but l heard you claiming to be my father. I am sorry for what I'm about to say but you can never be my dad and l will never call you father, for it is a shame to have a father like you and a disgrace to the name FATHER. I don't need you in my life. I only know my mother, and she is my father as well With all due respect Mr Rwizi get lost before l call the security. "Anopaishe said in anger. Mr Rwizi did not leave. Security! Throw him out." Mr Rwizi was thrown out of Mufaro's house and got a taste of his own medicine.

317 - 16 Dec 2023 10:44PM - +91 84272 64623: Once upon a time there was a girl named Amina who was living abroad. Amina was born and raised in a vibrant village in Malawi, where she grew up surrounded by the rich culture and traditions of her community.  As Amina got older, she developed a deep curiosity about the world beyond her village. She dreamt of exploring new places, meeting people from different backgrounds, and experiencing diverse cultures. With determination in her heart, Amina set off on a journey to study abroad in London.  Arriving in the bustling city, Amina felt a mix of excitement and nervousness. Everything seemed so different from what she was used to - the towering buildings, the fast-paced lifestyle, and the diverse mix of people from all around the world.  But Amina embraced the challenges and embraced her new home. She quickly made friends from various countries, each with their own unique stories and experiences. They would gather to share their favorite dishes, dance to African beats, and teach each other about their respective cultures.  Amina's time in London was filled with incredible opportunities for growth and learning. She pursued her passion for art and discovered a love for photography, capturing the beauty of the city through her lens. She also became an advocate for cultural exchange, organizing events that celebrated the richness of African heritage.  Even though Amina was far from her homeland, she never forgot her roots. She proudly shared her African traditions with her friends, introducing them to vibrant festivals, traditional clothing, and the warmth of her community back home.  Through her experiences, Amina realized that home is not just a physical place but a feeling of belonging and connection. She carried the spirit of Africa with her wherever she went, spreading joy, understanding, and celebrating the beauty of diversity.  And so, Amina's journey abroad became a beautiful chapter in her life, allowing her to bridge cultures, make lifelong friendships, and inspire others with her vibrant spirit.  The end.

289 - 16 Dec 2023 09:12AM - +263 78 511 0068: Saturday Activity   There was a boy named Thomas who is really good at sports, but he struggles in school. He was to decide whether to cheat on his tests to get good grades , or accept that he might not be the best at everything.  Thomas was always the fastest runner on his school's track team. He loved the feeling of winning races and getting applause from the crowd. But when it came to school work he didn't do as well. His grades were low , and he had trouble paying attention in class. One day, Thomas's teacher offered him a deal. She said she would give him better grades if he helped her with some of the work.  If Thomas accepts the deal, he could get better grades. But if he helped his teacher cheat he is not really earning his grades. He would be sacrificing his integrity.  Thomas went to his teacher and told her that he couldn't help her cheat.He said he believed that everyone should earn their grades honestly. At first, his teacher was angry and some of his classmates were upset too. But over time, his teacher realized that Thomas was right. She stopped giving students special treatment and started grading them fairly. And some of his classmates started working harder in school, just like Thomas had.  In the end , Thomas was glad he had made the right decision even though it had been difficult. He felt like he had learned an important lesson.  Sometimes doing the right thing is hard. But it's always worth it.   Providence

154 - 19 Dec 2023 02:12PM - +263 71 562 2820: GLP is a system assurance that labs use to ensure integrity,consistency and reproductibility within non clinical studies and tests.GLP stands for GOOD LABORATORY PRACTICE.GLP regulations are not concerned with the technical or scientific ,content of research but they are rather concerned with the quality assurance.In GLP there are rules which should be followed by the experimenters .There is a rule which states that every test should be conducted using protocols and written standard operating procedures to ensure that the results are repeatable .In GLP equipments should be in correct working order  following a correct  program of qualifications , maintenance and calibration.GLP covers equipment including suitability for a study. GLP is followed so that correct equipments can be used at their correct intervals .GLP also affects scales and balances and they should be calibrated for use in studies with frequency  of calibrations defined as part of  regular operation procedures mentioned earlier by the calibrators. Documentation of calibration and other types of equipments tested have to be retained too.GLPis well considered so that after experiments,raw data has to reflect the procedures and conditions of study  while the final report which is usually provided to authorities must include an account of the way the analysis was performed with scientific interpretation of data.
155 - 19 Dec 2023 02:37PM - +263 71 562 2820: Sterilisation methods used in laboratories are 1)Dry heat 2)Autoclaving 3)Filtration 4)Radiation 5)Solvents 6)Flash sterilisation I can explain Autoclaving Autoclaving is the most used method of sterilisation in many laboratories.There is the  use of an  autoclave . An autoclave is a machine which is used in laboratories to elevate temperature and pressure in relation to ambient temperature or pressure. Many autoclaves are used to sterilise equipments  and supplies by subjecting them to pressurised saturated steam at 121degrees for 30 to 60 minutes at a pressure of 205 Pascals above atmospheric pressure depending on the load and contents.

221 - 19 Dec 2023 09:15AM - +263 71 870 6208: Question 3. What is the difference between a prosecutor and attorney.  A prosecutor is a lawyer who works for a state or government organisation and is responsible for starting legal proceedings and then proving in court that the suspect committed crime he's accused of. Prosecutors are responsible for gathering evidence ,prosecuting cases and present then to a court.The prosecutors job is to see that all the relevant facts including those favourable to an accussed are placed before the court and to present those facts in an ethical, fair dispassionate , firm and clear manner.Whereas an Attorney is an individual who is legally empowered to act on someone else's behalf. They do not require any legal qualifications for instance an older relative can ask someone to be an attorney and act on their behalf ,even if you're not a lawyer  A prosecutor typically works for the government agency bringing criminal charges and must prove the defendants guilty beyond a reasonable doubts, while the attorney represents the person accused of a crime and attempts to maintain the clients innocense.

171 - 19 Dec 2023 01:27PM - +263 77 756 4664: *B.Sc in Medical Laboratory Technology- Academic lnterview responses for Chibondo George Anotidaishe*   1 Audio format response 2 Medical laboratory technology involves laboratory testing and analysis that help diagnose and treat medical conditions. lt  is vital in patient health and helps identify causes of illness  for early treatment 3 Good Laboratory Practice is a set of principles and procedures that ensures a quality and consistency of results it is important for labs to follow GLP so that results are reliable to make decisions for patients care. 4 Methods of sterilization include autoclaving, chemical sterilization which uses chemicals as ethylene oxide to kill microorganism, physical sterilization as dry heat and ultraviolet radiation these prevent the spread of infectious diseases by reducing cross-contamination and ensures that lab equipment are safe to use.Autoclaving works by placing items into a sealed chamber with high temperature and pressure for about 15 minutes and these work together to kill microorganisms the items are then removed and cooled. 5 Different techniques can be used one common is the wet mount method, a small amount of the sample is placed on a glass slide and a coverslip is placed on top. A drop of water  or another liquid is added to the slide to help keep the sample in place and easy viewing. Another is dry mount method, a sample is placed directly on the slide without any liquid.

148 - 16 Dec 2023 08:26PM - +263 77 140 5373: *Some common causes of Gas pipeline vibration 20 Carbon steel lines*  1. *Possibility that the gas is reaching critical flow downstream* Critical flow occurs when the flow velocity in a channel equals the wave velocity generated by a disturbance  2. *Compressor Surging* Occurs when the amount of gas trying to be compressed is insufficient for the size of the compressor hence blades lose their ability to transfer energy from the shaft to the fluid causing a reverse flow of the gas  3. *Pressure cycling in the tower* Takes place when fluctuations occurs during the course of operations as we start, stop pumps and move oil products with varying densities and viscosities  4. *Two phase flow* Occurs in various forms such as flows transitioning from pure liquid to vapor as a result of external heating and separated flows
149 - 16 Dec 2023 08:27PM - +263 77 140 5373: *Using a pumping loop to mix miscible fluids in a tank the contents are considered well mixed when:*  Firstly to understand a pumping loop, it is a system that circulates fluids in a closed loop to mix them. Once the fluids have been mixed in the tank the general rule to consider a well mixture is to turn the tank over three times and then sample the tank for mixture properties. By turning the tank over, you actually force the entire volume of the tank through the pump at least three times. Some more turnovers may also be necessary in some instances.
150 - 16 Dec 2023 08:27PM - +263 77 140 5373: *General rules for flushing  slurry lines*  A slurry line is a specially engineered pipeline used to move ores such as coal/iron or mining waste over long distances. A mixture of the ore concentrate and water called slurry is pumped to its destination and water filtered out.  Some of the general rules:  Slurry lines should be flushed with a minimum fluid velocity of 10 ft/s and the total flushing liquid volume should be equal to three to six times the total piping volume. The pump should also not be rotating and the liquid in the pump should be stationery, not flowing in or out of the pump prior to starting the flush procedure. If there is a closed discharge valve in the system the vent valve between the pump and the discharge valve must be open.
151 - 16 Dec 2023 08:28PM - +263 77 140 5373: *Pneumatic conveying*  It is a method for transferring dry bulk materials like powders and granules using compressed  gas or air from one processing centre to another through an enclosed conveying line using a  combination of pressure differential and airflow from a blower fan or compressor. It is an efficient means of handling and transferring various types of bulk granular and powdered products with minimal loss and lower cost than n other systems  *There are 2 main types:* Lean phase and dense phase  *Lean phase*- is commonly used and is used for granules and powders. There are 2 categories under Lean phase : 1) Dilute phase - it is for conveying non-abrasive materials with low bulk density e.g flour It has a gas velocity greater than  17 ms‚Äê¬π with lower vacuum  2) Medium phase - particles travelling through pipeline remain suspended throughout with a low concentration or solids loading ratio.  *Dense phase* - is ideal for moving sensitive and fragile products. Products travel at lower velocities and some common applications include abrasives such as sugar and blended products.

132 - 15 Dec 2023 04:31PM - +263 77 623 2165: (2. Elaborate on the difference between rights and duties and give a further explanation of the difference in Human rights and Civil rights   Rights, a right is a power or claim possessed by an individual to do something for example children have the right to education whilst Duty is an obligation to do or omit to do something for example Parents is their duty to fulfill their needs and wants. Moreover, right is an interest recognized and protected by the state whereas Duty is an obligation created and imposed by the state. Also, every legal right has a corresponding duty whilst every legal duty has not a corresponding right. In addition, a person whose right is violated can go to court for remedy whilst a person who has not full filled his duty is subjected to punishment. Furthermore, a person is free to not exercise his rights whilst a person is not free to not fulfill his duties. Rights help to control others action as per own wish whilst Duty impose obligations to act as per other's will. Human rights are rights one acquires by being alive whilst Civil rights are rights that one obtains by being a legal member of a certain political state. Human rights include, the right to life and the right to education. Civil rights include protection from discrimination.   (3. The difference between a prosecutor and an attorney.   Prosecutor, government official charged with bringing defendants in criminal cases to justice in the name of the state. Prosecutors are in charge of all phases of a criminal proceeding from the investigation by the police through the trial and beyond to all levels of appeal. Many also defend the state in civil actions. In the United kingdom, prosecution is carried out in the name of the crown. In this sense the crown can be said to prosecute and the prosecution is often referred to as "the crown",whereas an attorney they provide professional advice, prepare documents, and appear in court to plead on behalf of their clients on litigation involving them and research all case elements , including official documentation in including a police report. They pay close attention to the legal system elements that pertain to the client's case and search for relevant, previously filed pleadings. Attorneys formulate strategy on behalf of clients intending to find timely and look effective ways to manage legal issues. Rather than take a case to trial, attorneys attempt to resolve it promptly. Attorneys familiarize themselves with a client's case.   (4. Which branch of law are you most interested in pursuing, Civil, Corporate or Criminal, and why?   Criminal law, the body of law that defines criminal offenses, regulates the apprehension, charging and trial of suspected person and fixes penalties and modes of treatment applicable to convicted offenders. This branch am interested in pursuing it because there are some cases whereby one is charged for a crime that they did not commit and spend their rest of their lives in prison so I took it upon myself to be more interested in the criminal branch so that I can prove their Innocence and provide justice. The criminal branch is the only one of the devices by which organized societies protect the security of individual interests and ensure the survival of the group. There are in addition the standards of conduct instilled bt family , school, and religion, the rules of the office and factory. The branch serves the purpose of criminal law which prevent crime with the development of the social sciences there arose new concepts, such as those of the protection of the public and the reform of the offender. Am more interested in the important differences exist between the criminal law of most , English speaking countries.   (5. What skills do you believe you have that will make you a successful lawyer   Firstly, there is good verbal communication, a lot depends on how well the legal professional can express his or her case, arguments and generally converse with clients and authorities. Good verbal communication ensures good expression and understanding. Secondly, I have good time management I have the art of delegation tasks, working within, deadlines, and prioritizing tasks, to achieve success is very essential. Moreover, self-confidence. I have the ability to have a strong belief in myself which will go a long way in winning arguments and cases. Furthermore, Patience is an attribute of my skill. I have the ability to deal with different types of people and some cases , and procedures stretch over a period of time which my patience is needed and careful handling. Lastly team work skills, since the field am going to learn will deal with a lot of people therefore to be effective there is need to bond with people. The art of getting work done and obtaining information with people helps in attaining the objectives

280 - 19 Dec 2023 09:37PM - Austin: Let me please help you with the financial aspects of the program.  *Cost of education* The cost of education is reduced from $6000-$8000 to $2000-$3000 per annum which includes Tuition fees, Accommodation, Food, Wifi, Laundry, Library fee etc. It is paid in two equal instalments, each instalment before a semester. This cost can be further reduced by Lenos through the earnings from the Earn While You Learn program  *Enrollment fee* For all the services and assistance including Applications to Universities, Statement of Purpose, Visa Documentation Assistance, University Selection and sessions, Earn While You Learn program and training, etc all you have is $350 which can either be paid in two phases($200 in 7 days and remaining within the next 30 days) or together
281 - 19 Dec 2023 09:38PM - Austin: *Registration Fee* The registration fee($500-$1000) is to be paid after you receive the Offer letter from University after the University sessions and then you receive the Admission Acceptance Letter.  *The registration fee isn't an additional fee as it is waived from the cost of education.*  For example, if your cost of education after the scholarship is $2200 per annum and the registration fee is $600, then while you are in India you need to pay only the remaining amount which is $2200-600= $1600  The cost of transportation and visa application is catered by a student's family
282 - 19 Dec 2023 09:47PM - +263 77 903 3457: Ok, understood. Now the other question is, is there room for the child to pursue his aeronautical career of interest

284 - 19 Dec 2023 09:48PM - Austin: We offer Aerospace Engineering
292 - 19 Dec 2023 09:56PM - Austin: Also, be careful if any University offers the course with the current combination, because the degree won't be approved as per the AICTE norms and won't be valued.

295 - 19 Dec 2023 10:01PM - Austin: Here are some ways in which a Bachelor of Technology in Computer Science Engineering could be beneficial in the aeronautical field:  Software Development: Aeronautical engineering involves a significant amount of software development for designing, simulating, and testing aircraft components. Knowledge of programming languages, algorithms, and software development methodologies can be valuable in creating and maintaining the software used in aeronautical applications.  Data Analysis and Machine Learning: Aeronautical engineers often deal with large datasets for simulations, testing, and performance analysis. A background in computer science can be useful for applying data analysis techniques and machine learning algorithms to extract meaningful insights from these datasets.  Control Systems and Automation: Computer science skills can be applied in the development of control systems and automation in aircraft. This includes programming and implementing algorithms for autopilot systems, navigation, and other automated processes.  Cybersecurity: As aircraft systems become more connected and reliant on digital technologies, the importance of cybersecurity in the aeronautical field increases. Knowledge of computer security and network protocols can be crucial in protecting critical systems from cyber threats.  Simulation and Modeling: Computer simulations play a vital role in aeronautical engineering for testing designs and predicting the performance of aircraft. CSE graduates can contribute to the development and improvement of simulation software used in the aeronautical industry.  While a B.Tech in CSE provides a strong foundation in computer science, individuals interested in working in the aeronautical field may benefit from gaining additional knowledge in aeronautical or aerospace engineering through certifications, specialized courses, or even pursuing a master's degree in aerospace engineering. This interdisciplinary approach can enhance your capabilities and make you more competitive in the aeronautical job market. It's also essential to stay updated on industry trends and technologies to bridge the gap between computer science and aeronautical engineering.

B SECTION 5 The Rwanda story is one of the hate, despair and resillience in building a nation . It is very clear that we do not only need to learn from history, but we need to make faster links between the past and the present. History should be transformed into lessons for humanity that are relevant to today's societies. The history of Rwanda and the inspiring and haunting stories of individually communities and governments during the genocide, the example can teach us much about moral choices and their consequences . The price of mass atrocities and genocide is always very high. After the genocide ended in juli 1994 , Rwanda was a devastated country it's basic infrastructure was destroyed, millions of people were diplaced and many surviving tsutsi's had lost their families. Rape and sexual violence was common among many women. Thousands of children were orphaned and had to fend themselves. Countless of survivors developed long term phycological problems. However Rwandese people have shown their resillience and embarked on building their nation . Today Rwanda remains one of the most developed nations in Africa. There has been robust infrastructure development. Development has also seen in areas of education and healthy. Good leadership has been at the centre of this success. SECTION 6 MY INSPIRATIONAL STORY I have always looked to my brother inspiration. I have two brothers and am the only girl, I came in between two the brothers. My brothers are intelligent and self motivated and like studying, you don't need to push them to study. By the way my elder brother is a third year engineering student at the University of Zambia. He is born mathematician and was always top his class, on the other hand I need great inspiration to study and hence I thought of myself as second best. However during my grade nine examinations I studied so hard that I surpassed my elder brother. I could not believe myself for this milestone achievement. From now onward I look at myself differently. I can do all things as long as I have the desire to do so. All things are possible to any one who believes. Thank you.

34 - 19 Dec 2023 12:55PM - Gurvinder: *Edoofa Scholarship Program* is a well-appreciated program in the SAARC nations and the African continent offering 50-100% scholarships on tuition fees and accommodation. 35 - 19 Dec 2023 12:55PM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. Edoofa has been in the Education space for more than a decade and one question that has always been on our table, and that we have been thinking about every year was *how to improve the quality of education for our candidates with affordability by providing employability skills*  One of the unique aspects of the program is the focus on the skill development of a student through the Earn While You Learn Program wherein a student receives real-time online projects, thereby gaining hands-on knowledge and experiences!
16 - 19 Dec 2023 12:33PM - Gurvinder: We receive applications from South Africa, Zimbabwe, Ghana, Nigeria, Malawi, Uganda, Zambia, Liberia, Kenya, Rwanda, Cameroon, and many more countries. 17 - 19 Dec 2023 12:33PM - Gurvinder: EDOOFA has commended the new government for its dedicated efforts and positive changes in the education sector, including the elimination of school fees, an increase in the number of teachers, and a focus on protecting vulnerable learners, particularly adolescent girls. *Edoofa is proud to support the government in its mission to transform the education sector and achieve sustainable development, aimed at ensuring quality education that is inclusive and equitable for all by 2030.*
18 - 19 Dec 2023 12:33PM - Gurvinder: With the influx of students from Zimbabwe, we recorded more than 1500 students to the program in each of the last two years. 19 - 19 Dec 2023 12:33PM - Gurvinder: *Our strong relationships with educational institutions, such as Penmal Connect Ltd. and Trident College in Zambia, have led to numerous successful outcomes and partnerships with schools including Kamulanga High, Canisius Secondary, Sanjongo Secondary, The Copperbelt University, Chavuma Boarding Secondary, Mutanda Boarding Secondary, Chimwemwe Secondary, National Hillcrest, Matero Boys Secondary, and others. The main reason arising from this is that the people who were offended still hold a grudge to the inhuman killing that transpired. In an interview the survivers of the war still look back and they still can't let go of it. It seems as if the incident still haunts them of how they lost their loved ones. One man in Rwanda said that he lost a lot of infrastructure, livestock and his relatives. Additionally six of his children were killed including his wife. This arises from the fact that people lack the knowledge on family planning. Most homes are overcrowded with relatives who survived the war. This is indeed dangerous as in it can lead to disease outbreak easily within a community On the positive side people after the war have been counselled and it can be seen that the people have learnt to forgive each other. Further more it has been seen that people in Rwanda are trying by all means possible to stop tribal conflict. It is encouraged that intermarriages should be practiced to avoid such occurences. Furthermore the government, in collaboration with it's citizen, is working tirelessly to bring Rwanda into a middle income nation where each human being can aquire basic needs with no stress at all. 261 - 19 Dec 2023 03:36PM - +263 78 828 3084: SECTION 5 : ESSAY WRITING  16 years after the genocide, Rwanda has made significant progress. The country has rebuilt its infrastructure and economy, and has implemented a number of policies aimed at promoting reconciliation and healing. However, there are still challenges that the country faces. In terms of infrastructure, Rwanda has made significant strides in rebuilding roads, hospitals, and schools. The country has also seen a significant increase in foreign investment, which has helped to boost the economy. The government's policy of "reconciliation villages" has been particularly successful in promoting healing. In these villages, people who committed genocide and people who were victimized by the genocide live together and work on rebuilding their communities. This policy has helped to break down barriers between people and has allowed them to learn to trust and respect one another. However, the country still faces a number of challenges. One challenge is the high level of poverty. Although the economy has grown, many people still struggle to make ends meet. Another challenge is the prevalence of HIV/AIDS, which has affected a significant percentage of the population.Another challenge facing Rwanda is the issue of justice and accountability. Many of the perpetrators of the genocide have not been brought to justice. This has caused some victims to feel that their voices have not been heard and that justice has not been served. Additionally, there is a lack of trust in the government and institutions, as some people feel that the government has not done enough to address the root causes of the genocide. Despite these challenges, Rwanda has made remarkable progress in the 16 years since the genocide. The country has shown that it is possible to rebuild and move forward, even after such a devastating event. Rwanda's experience is an inspiration to other

We had to learn how to live without my father's income, and it was a struggle to pay for the necessities, let alone school fees. My mother tried to keep our lives as normal as possible, but there were many nights when we went to bed hungry. My mother's sacrifice and determination were an inspiration to me and i vowed to make the best of my life and make something of myself. I am determined to make my father proud and live a life that honors his memory  The difficult times my mother and I faced after my father's death taught me many valuable lessons. I learned that resilience and determination can overcome even the most difficult challenges. With hard work and perseverance, we can achieve our goals, no matter what obstacles we face. As I look back on this experience, I am grateful for the strength and courage my mother showed, and I know that I can overcome any obstacle that comes my way. Computer Engineer would have various job opportunities in various MNC‚Äôs . as Computer Engineer, Software developer, Software tester, Network administrator, Database administrator, Database designer, Database operator, Website designer, Website developer, Mobile application developer, Robotics expert, Software analyst. 261 - 19 Dec 2023 04:20PM - Sahil Edoofa: I understand what you are sharing, basically, my motive behind asking such a question was the fact that, as a counsellor, I have helped tens of thousands of students in the last 5 and a half years in Zimbabwe, and I do understand that financial stability in an economy like Zimbabwe is quite difficult these days. This is why I want to ask you if your child manages to pass the eligibility check stage, then you would have to complete payment of $350 towards the enrollment fee.  I feel in Zimbabwe, economic hardship has become a daily reality for parents as the country struggles with a fragile economy and high unemployment rate. In the past decade, Zimbabwe has seen hyperinflation, a collapse of the currency, a high poverty rate, and a rising cost of living. This has caused financial instability for many Zimbabwean families and made it increasingly difficult for parents to provide for their children. Parents are often forced to take on multiple jobs to make ends meet and many have had to cut back on basic necessities such as food, clothing, and education. Many parents have had to leave their children in the care of relatives or send them to live with friends in order to provide for them. This has put an enormous strain on the family unit as well as on the children who are not receiving the parental care and attention they need.
262 - 19 Dec 2023 04:20PM - Sahil Edoofa: Since Edoofa has been in existence for over 6 years in Africa and 14+ years as a Scholarship Program, It predominantly boasts a student community of 1500+ students. There have been instances where Students have applied to the program to see what happens next and their inquisitiveness without proper financial preparations and discussions with the family has led to consequences that are not a positive remark to the student's profile for tertiary education. The following were taken as remedial and disciplinary action by the board:-  1. The application was revoked and the student's scholarship seat was awarded to another student who as of the moment would be on the waiting list.  2. On the application of the student, disciplinary action was taken due to which the student gets barred for Three years from Edoofa Scholarship Program. 285 - 18 Dec 2023 05:11PM - Sahil Edoofa: Please note that the intake for 2024 is already open and Form 6 students are reserving their seats for the same if qualified for the Edoofa Scholarship Program. The major reason for opening the Seat Reservation opportunity for Zimbabwean students is that they receive the results very late compared to other African Nations. The WAEC results of Ghana, Nigeria and other Western African Nations were declared on *7th August this year*, Malawians received their MSCE results in September, Zambians receive the results this year itself when compared to Zimsec A level results(January-February 2024), and they are declared much earlier and the students from other nations will be occupying the majority of the scholarship seats. This is the reason, we evaluate the O level and term results, interests and passion, career goals, extracurriculars, achievements, roles of responsibilities etc to evaluate the form 6 students for the Edoofa scholarship program. We also give the opportunity to parents to take part in the sessions on behalf of applicants so that deserving applicants do not miss the golden opportunity. *So we already have 700+ Zimbabwean students who have qualified for the next intake.*

200 - 19 Dec 2023 10:01AM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: Basically there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program. *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee before their A-Level result is out). *Phase 3:* Once the final A results are out if the student would have passed the necessary requirement as per Edoofa then their final University evaluation and Admission would be continued. However if the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements as per the University and Edoofa, then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents. *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment.*
201 - 19 Dec 2023 10:01AM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: However, we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

314 - 19 Dec 2023 10:33AM - Shashwat Edoofa 2: I understand what you are sharing, basically, my motive behind asking such a question was the fact that, as a counsellor, I have helped tens of thousands of students in the last 5 and a half years in Zimbabwe, and I do understand that financial stability in an economy like Zimbabwe is quite difficult these days. This is why I want to ask you if your child manages to pass the eligibility check stage, then you would have to complete payment of $350 towards the enrollment fee.  I feel in Zimbabwe, economic hardship has become a daily reality for parents as the country struggles with a fragile economy and high unemployment rate. In the past decade, Zimbabwe has seen hyperinflation, a collapse of the currency, a high poverty rate, and a rising cost of living. This has caused financial instability for many Zimbabwean families and made it increasingly difficult for parents to provide for their children. Parents are often forced to take on multiple jobs to make ends meet and many have had to cut back on basic necessities such as food, clothing, and education. Many parents have had to leave their children in the care of relatives or send them to live with friends in order to provide for them. This has put an enormous strain on the family unit as well as on the children who are not receiving the parental care and attention they need.

216 - 19 Dec 2023 09:49AM - Shubham Madhwal: Basically, there are 3 phases of the enrollment process.  *Phase 1:* Counseling session with the Students/Parents and Seat Reservation  If the student is found competent for the program and receives their Reservation Letter, you will have to pay only a part of the Program Fee which is $350 within 7 days from the receipt of your Edoofa Reservation Letter which basically is for the seat reservation and the Earn While You Learn Program.
217 - 19 Dec 2023 09:49AM - Shubham Madhwal: *Phase 2:* Once the students complete their Phase 1 they will be starting their Earn While you Learn program classes (Each student will have an opportunity to earn credits that can be used to reduce the fee, before their Grade 12 result is out).
218 - 19 Dec 2023 09:49AM - Shubham Madhwal: *Phase 3:* Once the final grade 12 results are out, if the student would have passed the necessary requirement (of 4 Grade 12 passes.) then start with their University Interaction. If the student wouldn't have met the necessary requirements then the paid $350 would be refunded to the parents.   *The amount of credit earned by the students during Phase 2 can be used for the student's first year's annual fee as well so that parents do not end up being burdened at the last moment.*

122 - 18 Dec 2023 05:42PM - Shubham Madhwal: *B.A. (Hons.) in Sociology* is an undergraduate program that deals with various aspects of social behavior and its consequence on modern society. Sociology is a branch of study which investigates multiple aspects of society and social behavior which helps them to do social work. A Bachelor's degree in Sociology teaches the fundamental concepts related to the structure of society, organization of society, and how humans interact within these constructs. The basic subject matter of Sociology concerns itself with topics related to family structure, global warfare, religious cults, social class, race, and gender, etc.  *Course Outline*  This program provides you with an understanding of core traditions and contemporary developments in sociological thinking and research. The theories and methods we explore enable us to examine the character and workings of the social institutions that govern people‚Äôs lives and encourage us to critically question the social values we live by. This program provides you with an understanding of core traditions and contemporary developments in sociological thinking and research. The theories and methods we explore enable us to examine the character and workings of the social institutions that govern people‚Äôs lives, and encourage us to critically question the social values we live by.  *Career Opportunities*  This degree course enables the students to go for various Sociology related jobs such as in industry, commerce, the NHS, education authorities, further and higher education, and charitable, counseling, and voluntary organizations. One can go for higher degree programs in respective subjects for further research work in Sociology.  Opportunities also exist for sociology graduates in the civil service and graduate management training schemes. Sociology graduates work with a varied and diverse client group during the course of their career.  *Bachelor of Arts in Sociology* includes a number of compulsory subjects. Along with that, the students will also have to choose from a number of elective subjects. The elective subjects may differ from college to college.  The subjects of study in the *BA Sociology course* curriculum are tabulated below:  Module 1: Introducing Sociology Module 2: Introducing India Module 3: Classical Sociological Thinkers I Module 4: Social Interaction and Social Relationships Module 5: Classical Sociological Thinkers II Module 6: Body, Culture and Cultural Contestations Module 7: Social Institutions I Module 8: Social Theory I Module 9: Social Institutions II Module 10: Social Theory II Module 11: Research Method I Module 12: Social Stratification Module 13: Research Method II Module 14: Social Challenges and Movements Module 15: Change, Development, Globalization Module 16: Dissertation  _*BA Sociology: Elective Subjects*_ Some of the important elective papers include:  Sociology of Development	Sociology of Indian Society Principles of Sociology	Social Psychology Economic Sociology	Political Sociology Sociology of Education	Sociology of Mass Communication Social Anthropology	Life Skill Education Women Studies	Sociology of Mass Media

308 - 19 Dec 2023 03:35PM - Shubham Madhwal: If you understand the concept of international education finances that play a major role are not visa fees and flight tickets. The flight ticket is required a very limited number of times as the students don't travel that often. I don't mean to say that students can not go back to their country, they can definitely go back to enjoy the holidays. What I have personally seen is, the students do not travel that often.
309 - 19 Dec 2023 03:35PM - Shubham Madhwal: So, considering the main finance which plays the most important role in international education is the annual fees. So, to reduce this annual fee, edoofa helps a student with the Earn While You Learn Program. This program provides the students with an opportunity to earn scholarship credits which in return help them to make their education more affordable. Visa fees and flight tickets are to be bought just a month before they plan to come to India. So, let's say the student wants to come to India in August 2024, This means that his family has to cover the Visa fee and the ticket in July 2024. If you understand the concept properly, till July 2024, the student will be working in the Earn While You Learn program and will be earning Scholarship credits. Now, with this opportunity, you can save a lot of money on the annual fee which in return helps you to make your flight ticket and the Visa fee affordable.

If a person suddenly encounters any terrible danger, the change of nature one undergoes is equally great. Sometimes fear numbs our senses. On the other hand, frequently in cases of sudden extreme peril, which cannot be escaped by flight, and must be instantly faced, even the most timid men at once as if by miracle, become possessed of the necessary courage, sharp quick apprehension and swift decision. This is a miracle very common in nature. Man and the inferior animals alike, when confronted with almost certain death ‚Äò gather resolution from despair‚Äô but there can really be no trace of so debilitating a feeling in the person fighting, or prepare d to fight for dear life. At such times the mind is clearer than it has ever been; the nerves are steel, there is nothing felt but a wonderful strength and daring. 112 - 19 Dec 2023 03:48PM - Shubham Madhwal: *BSc Cardiovascular Technology* is a 3-year degree program that deals with diagnosing and monitoring diseases related to the heart and the circulatory system.  In this program, students will get familiar with various complex procedures such as performing stent implants, setting up cardiac pacemakers and defibrillators in the treatment of heart diseases.  The BSc Cardiovascular Technology syllabus includes subjects such as Human Anatomy, Cardiovascular System, Physiology, Pathology, Electrocardiography and Echocardiography.  BSc Cardiovascular Technology degree holders will be able to find work in various sectors such as Hospitals, Universities, Health organizations etc.  They may also serve as Cardiovascular Technician, Cardiovascular Technologist, Medical Sonographer, etc. Graduates have the opportunity to work in India or Abroad to pursue graduate studies and to get involved in research activities.  After completing this course, students can pursue higher studies and advanced academic exploration along with research through MSc and Certificate Courses. Students can also pursue MBA, PGDM courses. These courses essentially provides a solid basis for further studies and related prospects.  *BSc Cardiovascular Technology: What is it about?* Read the points given below to know what BSc Cardiovascular Technology course is all about:  BSc in Cardiovascular Technology deals with various topics on the vascular or the circulatory system. Through this course, one gets to learn about the arteries, veins and the blood vessels that carry blood throughout the human body. These blood vessels are also instrumental in delivering oxygen and essential nutrients to the body tissues.  With the help of this course one gets to learn about the various cardiovascular diseases that affect the human body.   This course also helps a cardiovascular technologist or technician to learn about the various procedures and tests while assisting the physician in diagnosing and treating a patient ailing from heart disease. Some of the complex procedures that a student learns in this course are implanting of stents and setting up a pacemaker. They learn through this course, both invasive  as well as non-invasive procedures in the treatment of heart diseases.  *Why Should You Study a BSc Cardiovascular Technology course?*  BSc Cardiovascular Technology is a prestigious and popular stream of study in the field of allied health sciences. This field of study has a lot of importance and applications as it concerns directly with the treatment of heart diseases. Let us see here some of the reasons why one should study B.Sc Cardiovascular Technology.  With more and more people suffering from heart diseases because of many factors including lifestyle, genetics and environment, the importance of this field of study is ever increasing. Cardiologists and other heart surgeons greatly depend upon the services and support of cardiovascular technologists and technicians for carrying out various complex procedures on patients suffering from heart ailments.   With congenital heart diseases too on the rise, that is those that are prevalent in patients from birth itself, there is an increased awareness among different walks of people about the risks associated with such heart diseases. This in turn, further brings the field in limelight, as people are more likely to avail the services of a cardiovascular technologist. The numerous advances in the medical field in this domain has been a boon for patients and the medical fraternity alike. With rapid advances in the field, the services are getting more and more affordable, with many availing such services.

86 - 19 Dec 2023 11:00AM - Shubham Madhwal: *BSc Cardiovascular Technology* is a 3-year degree program that deals with diagnosing and monitoring diseases related to the heart and the circulatory system.  In this program, students will get familiar with various complex procedures such as performing stent implants, setting up cardiac pacemakers and defibrillators in the treatment of heart diseases.  The BSc Cardiovascular Technology syllabus includes subjects such as Human Anatomy, Cardiovascular System, Physiology, Pathology, Electrocardiography and Echocardiography.  BSc Cardiovascular Technology degree holders will be able to find work in various sectors such as Hospitals, Universities, Health organizations etc.  They may also serve as Cardiovascular Technician, Cardiovascular Technologist, Medical Sonographer, etc. Graduates have the opportunity to work in India or Abroad to pursue graduate studies and to get involved in research activities.  After completing this course, students can pursue higher studies and advanced academic exploration along with research through MSc and Certificate Courses. Students can also pursue MBA, PGDM courses. These courses essentially provides a solid basis for further studies and related prospects.  *BSc Cardiovascular Technology: What is it about?* Read the points given below to know what BSc Cardiovascular Technology course is all about:  BSc in Cardiovascular Technology deals with various topics on the vascular or the circulatory system. Through this course, one gets to learn about the arteries, veins and the blood vessels that carry blood throughout the human body. These blood vessels are also instrumental in delivering oxygen and essential nutrients to the body tissues.  With the help of this course one gets to learn about the various cardiovascular diseases that affect the human body.   This course also helps a cardiovascular technologist or technician to learn about the various procedures and tests while assisting the physician in diagnosing and treating a patient ailing from heart disease. Some of the complex procedures that a student learns in this course are implanting of stents and setting up a pacemaker. They learn through this course, both invasive  as well as non-invasive procedures in the treatment of heart diseases.  *Why Should You Study a BSc Cardiovascular Technology course?*  BSc Cardiovascular Technology is a prestigious and popular stream of study in the field of allied health sciences. This field of study has a lot of importance and applications as it concerns directly with the treatment of heart diseases. Let us see here some of the reasons why one should study B.Sc Cardiovascular Technology.  With more and more people suffering from heart diseases because of many factors including lifestyle, genetics and environment, the importance of this field of study is ever increasing. Cardiologists and other heart surgeons greatly depend upon the services and support of cardiovascular technologists and technicians for carrying out various complex procedures on patients suffering from heart ailments.   With congenital heart diseases too on the rise, that is those that are prevalent in patients from birth itself, there is an increased awareness among different walks of people about the risks associated with such heart diseases. This in turn, further brings the field in limelight, as people are more likely to avail the services of a cardiovascular technologist. The numerous advances in the medical field in this domain has been a boon for patients and the medical fraternity alike. With rapid advances in the field, the services are getting more and more affordable, with many availing such services.

97 - 19 Dec 2023 10:17AM - Tushti: Alright, let me brief you about the cost of higher education in India with respect to other countries and how Edoofa makes it affordable for students.
98 - 19 Dec 2023 10:17AM - Tushti: The cost of tertiary education in India is much lower than in Western countries. In India, the average cost of Higher Education for international students is around *6000-8000 USD*. In contrast, tuition fees for higher education in the UK, for example, can range from *USD 15000 to USD 35000*. Meanwhile, the US tuition cost is much higher, with the average cost of a 4-year degree ranging from *USD 80,000 to over USD 250,000.*
99 - 19 Dec 2023 10:17AM - Tushti: Now we wanted to make this cost of education even more affordable for the parents and students, *this is why our Parent Organisation Anhad Edutrain Solutions has worked with 250+ Universities for the last 14 years by helping them have the Employability Aspect in their education because of which from last 6 years Universities have been helping us to provide scholarship seats to the students so that their cost of education is reduced greatly.*

112 - 19 Dec 2023 11:13AM - Tushti: The Earn While You Learn Program or the EWYL Program is the backbone of Edoofa and the unique aspect of the whole program. It is a program in which the students are given real-time live online projects during which they gain excellent work experience while getting the opportunity to earn *scholarship credits* (based on student‚Äôs performance) that is equivalent to physical cash. However, the credits can be used to pay off a significant part of their higher education fees and make their university education more affordable.  It is the curriculum of the Earn While You Learn Program that helps students to learn and develop 21st-century job skills like Research, Content Writing, SEO, Digital Marketing, Creative Content Creation, Influencer Marketing, Social Media Engagement, and Blog Writing ‚Äì just to name a few.  The EWYL Program, therefore, is going to help in the overall growth of a student and help them provide a boost in keeping up with the changing market strategies, needs, and tactics.  Promising a better future for its students, and converting an Individual into a Market Ready Professional. Who would have every weapon in their arsenal to conquer the place they shall be landing their foot in.
142 - 19 Dec 2023 11:43AM - Tushti: Yes!
143 - 19 Dec 2023 11:44AM - Tushti: Since you have understood how Edoofa has made the application process simpler and affordable for the student, let me share with you the payment policy of the same for your better understanding!
144 - 19 Dec 2023 11:44AM - Tushti: You see Edoofa's exceptional program has opened up a world of opportunities for aspiring students, garnering thousands of applications on a daily basis. The Eligibility Evaluation process ensures that deserving candidates are granted the chance to participate in the program. *Once accepted, students are required to pay a nominal Program Fee of $350 within 7 days of receiving their acceptance letter*, following which they commence with their admission process and the esteemed Earn While You Learn Program. Edoofa's mission to provide quality education and support to students is at the heart of this initiative, and we are honored to make a difference in the lives of deserving individuals through this program.
145 - 19 Dec 2023 11:44AM - Tushti: However, as we do know that in most African Nations, economic instability is a major challenge because of which a student might face a challenge in completing their entire fee in a short time span of 7 days, therefore for such instances, parents are provided with flexible fee payment option as well, wherein if the student is found eligible then instead of paying the entire fee in 7 days, parents can complete a part fee of $200 in 7 days and the remaining $150 within next 30 days.

147 - 19 Dec 2023 12:12PM - Tushti: Now, let me brief you how the process follow after you are found eligible and enroll in the Program which is the Step 4 of Edoofa Cycle.
148 - 19 Dec 2023 12:12PM - Tushti: <Media omitted>
149 - 19 Dec 2023 12:12PM - Tushti: Alright Bright, so as we are at Step 1, after this you would be proceeding ahead to Step 2, and then if you would pass Step 2 you would receive your Acceptance Letter in Step 3, and after that, as you can see in the above image that the Enrollment Formalities is your Step 4 of the Edoofa Cycle, therefore in your Step 5: We will start your Admission Process as well as your SEELS (Earn While You Learn Program) Program by assigning your complete application to my Admission Officers, they will first prepare your Statement of Purpose and then send it to our Partner Universities.  Once we receive responses from the Universities, you will be given an Offer Letter from the Universities, where your scholarship, fees, etc. would be mentioned. At the same time with the help of the SEELS Program, you would be given assignments and projects to earn scholarship credits so that you could start reducing your annual fee while you would be in Zimbabwe itself. <This message was edited>
150 - 19 Dec 2023 12:12PM - Tushti: Finally in Step 6: Once you receive your offer letter from the university where your *exact annual fee and scholarship percentage will be mentioned* and the universities will give you a few weeks time to make the payment of registration fee which will be adjusted in your tuition fee, in order to reserve your seat in that particular University chosen by you.
151 - 19 Dec 2023 12:12PM - Tushti: Basically, this registration fee of $500-1000 will be waived off from your First Year's Fee and after that, *the remaining annual fee has to be paid after coming to India in 2 installments*. The first part will be paid in August (2024- 2025) and the remaining in January next year (2025-2026).

54 - 19 Dec 2023 12:29PM - Tushti: *Bachelor of Commerce (B.com)* is a three year long undergraduate course that is evenly distributed into 6 half-yearly semesters.  A high number of jobs are available for B.com graduates in industries such as Information Technology, Manufacturing, Telecommunications and Banking.The most sought after B.Com. jobs are Financial Manger, Accountant, Lecturer, Chartered Accountant, Human Resource Development etc.  The 3 year B.com degree program aims to facilitate a deep understanding of how business organizations work. It develops knowledge and skills in core B.com subjects like Accounting, Finance, Banking & Insurance, Marketing, Human Resources and Taxation. The entire B.com syllabus is designed in a manner which develops competency in students, allowing them to pursue higher level programs. It also increases practical knowledge and employability.  The subjects included in B.com program are as following:  *Accountancy* *Cost Account* *Statistics* *Management* *Human Resource* *Computer* *Economics* *English* *Law* *Marketing* *Finance*   After being awarded the B.Com degree, candidates can either look for jobs in various departments or opt for higher education.  *B.Com graduates can pursue post-graduation courses such as M.Com (Master of Commerce), MBA (Master of Business Administration), CA (Chartered Accountant), CS (Company Secretary), Actuarial Scientist, and ACCA (Association of Chartered Accountants).*  *B.Com graduates have a plethora of job positions in government as well as private sectors to choose from provided that they are not limited to careers in accounts and finance*

53 - 19 Dec 2023 12:18PM - Tushti: *B.A. (Hons.) in Sociology* is an undergraduate program that deals with various aspects of social behavior and its consequence on modern society. Sociology is a branch of study which investigates multiple aspects of society and social behavior which helps them to do social work. A Bachelor's degree in Sociology teaches the fundamental concepts related to the structure of society, organization of society, and how humans interact within these constructs. The basic subject matter of Sociology concerns itself with topics related to family structure, global warfare, religious cults, social class, race, and gender, etc.  *Course Outline*  This program provides you with an understanding of core traditions and contemporary developments in sociological thinking and research. The theories and methods we explore enable us to examine the character and workings of the social institutions that govern people‚Äôs lives and encourage us to critically question the social values we live by. This program provides you with an understanding of core traditions and contemporary developments in sociological thinking and research. The theories and methods we explore enable us to examine the character and workings of the social institutions that govern people‚Äôs lives, and encourage us to critically question the social values we live by.  *Career Opportunities*  This degree course enables the students to go for various Sociology related jobs such as in industry, commerce, the NHS, education authorities, further and higher education, and charitable, counseling, and voluntary organizations. One can go for higher degree programs in respective subjects for further research work in Sociology.  Opportunities also exist for sociology graduates in the civil service and graduate management training schemes. Sociology graduates work with a varied and diverse client group during the course of their career.  *Bachelor of Arts in Sociology* includes a number of compulsory subjects. Along with that, the students will also have to choose from a number of elective subjects. The elective subjects may differ from college to college.  The subjects of study in the *BA Sociology course* curriculum are tabulated below:  Module 1: Introducing Sociology Module 2: Introducing India Module 3: Classical Sociological Thinkers I Module 4: Social Interaction and Social Relationships Module 5: Classical Sociological Thinkers II Module 6: Body, Culture and Cultural Contestations Module 7: Social Institutions I Module 8: Social Theory I Module 9: Social Institutions II Module 10: Social Theory II Module 11: Research Method I Module 12: Social Stratification Module 13: Research Method II Module 14: Social Challenges and Movements Module 15: Change, Development, Globalization Module 16: Dissertation  _*BA Sociology: Elective Subjects*_ Some of the important elective papers include:  Sociology of Development	Sociology of Indian Society Principles of Sociology	Social Psychology Economic Sociology	Political Sociology Sociology of Education	Sociology of Mass Communication Social Anthropology	Life Skill Education Women Studies	Sociology of Mass Media
